business_name: Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong, an IHG Hotel
address: 88 East Coast Road, Katong, 423371 Singapore, Singapore

reviews.name: Peter
reviews.review_liked: Customer Service,  Accommodation,  facilities and everything.
reviews.review_disliked: Nil

reviews.name: Marcusgohjj
reviews.review_liked: The room was cozy, the staff were friendly and helpful, and breakfast had good variety and taste. The hotel is also located in an excellent location, with amenities, heritage buildings and interesting eateries nearby.
reviews.review_disliked: The day curtain could not close completely, meaning we either had to sacrifice natural light by closing the night curtain or sacrifice privacy. The toilet could be bigger, it would have been good if the hotel provided Shampoo, and we requested for some items through the app but they did not arrive.

reviews.name: Natasha
reviews.review_liked: The hotel was comfortable with quality beds and crisp, clean sheets. The air conditioning worked perfect which was needed since I’m not used to humidity. The area is walkable with restaurants galore. I would stay again without hesitation.
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing

reviews.name: Koji
reviews.review_liked:
Just awesome. 
I was in trouble to printed out my documents with colours. But, their staffed helped me a lot and finally they used their own PC to print out. 
Sorry I did not get their name but would like to express my thanks.

reviews.name: Rene
reviews.review_liked: The breakfast was OK. However, it was bothersome to us watching your staff use the same hand gloves cleaning and prepping the food. AND, it was disgusting that after letting one of your workers know that the serving spoon is swimming in the bowl, one of the customers took it out using a thong. Guess what your staff did? She wiped the handle instead of replacing it with a new one. We, several customers saw what she did. I know, because one said to me, "did you see what she did?".But, we're happy to let you know that the manager I interacted with (he looks Chinese), was awesomely cool, specially Mariz who helped us all the way + we adore her smile, like a breath of fresh air. Thank you for this survey. This will help your staff and your company learn and improve things.

reviews.review_disliked: Nothing really would stay again on next visit to Singapore

reviews.name: Natasha
reviews.review_head: Clean, quiet and comfortable stay with easy airport access and close to restaurants
reviews.review_liked: I loved staying at the Holiday Inn Express Singapore Katong.  The rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable with great air conditioning.  The breakfast was delicious with many good options—eggs, pastries, toast, fruit, coffee, juice etc.  The staff let us keep our luggage at the hotel when our cruise ship arrived early.  They also had a room available early and let us check in early around noon. It wasn’t hard to get a taxi from the airport to the hotel.  I would stay again.  There are great restaurants and shops close by.  I like this area of town.
reviews.review_disliked: Hotels in Singapore are pricey. This is also far from downtown but not hard to get a taxi for cheap into the city.

reviews.review_head: we would definitely use this hotel for a short stay

reviews.review_liked: We selected the hotel with the  understanding that Eunos MRT station is approachable but lateron we learn that bus stations are available on front & back of the hotel. Singapore maps help you to finalize your route and also inform you that when next bus shall arrive at the stop, it's help you to leave hotel on an appropriate time.

reviews.name: Venus
reviews.review_head: will stay at this hotel chain again
reviews.review_liked:
location and design of facilities in the room
breakfast plentiful to choose from and staff attentive at all times 
gave  me a very good impression on this hotel chain, will visit other branches but Singapore Katong will be top notch
reviews.review_disliked:
check out: the staff should give options to pay by cash or card, not to assume guests would pay by card deduction made during check in. credit card company charged hkd200 more than the sum stated in booking.com as a result. 
cash conversion is very unfriendly in Singapore, banks don’t do it and money chargers charge a fortune for it. so please remind guests they can pay with the remaining of cash in hand 
the deposit and room rent was charged in one bill which made it confusing. would prefer to separate the two and get an actual proof of cancel (of deposit) when I check out

reviews.review_disliked: I think all travellers should be more considerate for the facilities offered, but that’s on us. The staff do their best.

reviews.name: Megawati
reviews.review_liked: The location is far from the Singapore attractions area. But ! it's super easy to get the bus to go to MRT,merlion, and Marina Garden by the bay.  You just need to walk 5 minutes to the bus station and take bus no 14.
reviews.review_disliked: From my room,I still can hear people talk from others' rooms. .

reviews.name: Eileen
reviews.review_liked: Very friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful bed. Great breakfast.12 checkout. Interesting area.

reviews.name: Dede
reviews.review_head: No frills good value stay with everything you need
reviews.review_liked: Had everything you needed for a no frills comfortable stay. Breakfast was a nice bonus, standard hotel breakfast fare but very handy to start off the day. Great housekeeping, reception & front desk service. Queries were attended to promptly. Daily bottles of water provided. Powerful water pressure in showers. Comfy beds and bedding. Rooms on the small side but had everything you needed. Plenty of f&b choices surrounding the hotel. Easy access to buses makes getting around a breeze. Umbrellas for loan on a rainy afternoon.
reviews.review_disliked: Crowd at breakfast can be rather hectic. Lack of places to sit although the staff did their absolute best. Access to hotel via level 7 was slightly inconvenient with luggage in tow and the steps right at the entrance made maneuvering with luggage tricky just to get to the lifts. Lack of TV & entertainment channels with no streaming services. “Firm” pillows were still quite soft.

reviews.name: Andriaan
reviews.review_liked: Room was very clean. Breakfast had a sufficient choice so you don't get bored with each morning visit over 3 days. Location was really good to eateries, shopping and where our Singaporean family lives around Siglap and Bedok.

I requested online before check in for connecting rooms but wasn't confirmed. Upon checking in, I had to wait extremely long just to get the other room to form my connecting rooms. However I am still thankful towards the reception staff for their assistance.
The mini bar stated not delivered. It turned out to be an empty fridge with nothing inside.
One point to note, the toilet two in one door concept is my favorite, yet, the water from the bath leaked through the gap of the door causing the water to wet the entire toilet floor. It's slippery when one wears bedroom slippers.

Ibis doet altijd goed!


Ibis doet altijd goed!
reviews.review_liked: Wil je op een goed matras slapen, dan moet je naar Ibis. De kamers zijn altijd schoon en strak.

reviews.name: Devin
reviews.review_liked: room was comfy, pleasant & cheap.
reviews.review_disliked: no fridge & no water in the room, showerhead was faulty causing a cut on my wife's finger.

reviews.name: B
reviews.review_head: Size of room at this price
reviews.review_liked: Morden look and feel, at this price if I get bigger room then I will Not stay with them
reviews.review_disliked: Size of room at this price, no water bottle also,

reviews.name: S
reviews.review_liked: No latch in bathroom

reviews.name: Salmah
reviews.review_liked: Location was near where we needed to go. Convenient, near to a lot of shops & restaurants.
reviews.review_disliked: Did not like the way the mattresses were placed on the raised wooden board. Prefer normal beds for easy getting into and out of bed.

reviews.name: Azrina
reviews.review_liked: Room was clean
reviews.review_disliked: Aircond leaking, the matress too hard and springy..

reviews.name: Babie
reviews.review_liked: value for money

reviews.name: Ruby
reviews.review_head: We enjoyed our stay in Singapore.
reviews.review_liked: The room met our expectations given that it is a budget hotel. Our room is being cleaned everyday and the staff supplied us clean towels always. Coffee, creamer, and sugar, as well as tea are always refilled and there is abundant water in the dispenser where we can refill our tumblers. Staff are very accommodating and even lend us flat iron so we can iron our clothes everyday.
reviews.review_disliked: The comfort room though is a bit off for us since we are three persons in our room and the bathroom has a glass door. We can literally see someone who's using the toilet and it made us uncomfortable.

reviews.name: Peterplucker
reviews.review_head: Modern basic hotel in location close to old style Singapore with many restaurants near.
reviews.review_liked: Friendly lady on Reception was very helpful. Very quick to try to fix my room safe. Perfect for overnight crash pad in local worker’s area with many popular restaurants.
reviews.review_disliked: Room safe not working and easily carried away. Soundproofing from the corridor could be better.

reviews.name: Romel
reviews.review_liked: very good
reviews.review_disliked: small

reviews.name: Kristine
reviews.review_head: Good place for those who need spacious parking for trips
reviews.review_liked: Spacious parking, lots of sockets, clean enough
reviews.review_disliked: Mattress was a bit old. No fridge. On our second night staying at around 4 plus, one of the small lights flickered and popped. Had to remove all my chargers. No bidet. Used the shower head as a makeshift bidet.

reviews.name: Khristine
reviews.review_liked: Clean room and the loft in our room for three...
reviews.review_disliked: Worst wifi and no bidet and face towels...

reviews.name: Frisnedi
reviews.review_head: very good hotel for its price
reviews.review_liked: the price
reviews.review_disliked: the location

reviews.name: Somporn
reviews.review_liked: The bed was nice, and the room size is the same as many Ibis Hotel that I stayed in.
reviews.review_disliked: No Breakfast

reviews.name: Pek
reviews.review_liked: The water pressure for shower is superb.
reviews.review_disliked: Toilet bidet is not available. Private parking spaces are not sufficient.

reviews.name: Faizal
reviews.review_head: Decent for one or two nights stay. Would stay again.
reviews.review_liked: Clean moderate size room. Plenty of eateries nearby. Despite only being one level up, couldn’t hear noise from outside. Complimentary tea and coffee.
reviews.review_disliked: Had to keep the curtains drawn as opposite building could look directly into the room. Safe was shut so couldn’t be used. Didn’t get it looked at since I was only staying one night.

reviews.name: Wong

reviews.review_liked: The hotel was great value, one of the cheapest I could find close to the "center" of Singapore. Within walking distance of Singapore Stadium makes it a great budget option for people attending an event there. With bus stops nearby, and a train station not too far, it was very easy to get around. Bonus points for being on the same train line as the airport, making it very convenient when arriving and leaving. Concerning the hotel itself, the facilities were very clean and the AC efficient which was welcome in the Singapore heat.The area was nice with many, many affordable and diverse food shops available, usually open very late at night
reviews.review_disliked: If booking this hotel, do note that it is close to a "red light district" area. If you're a girl, majority of men will look at you insistently and many will try to approach you if you are on your own. Pill sellers are also common on the street too, but they will never bother you if you decide to ignore them.

reviews.name: Katy
reviews.room_type: Superior Triple Room with One Double Bed and One Single Bed
reviews.review_head: Good budget option in Little India
reviews.review_liked: The location is excellent if you like to immerse yourself in Indian culture, which we do. The room was lovely and clean and all the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.review_disliked: The only thing really was the room size...a bit of a squeeze! But unfortunately that's pretty standard for this price range in Singapore. The prices in Singapore, generally, have skyrocketed. It is what it is. Wifi wasn't consistent.

reviews.name: Deepa
reviews.room_type: Superior Triple Room with One Double Bed and One Single Bed
reviews.review_liked: Clean rooms , room service and housekeeping staff was excellent  and very responsive.
reviews.review_disliked: Reception staff needs training: their behaviour is not as should be in hospitality industry. Nothing in particular- just the body language is not welcoming. It shows they are just doing their job to finish it and be done with it ; and not genuinely interested in having guests or answering questions. An abrupt “ no” and nothing else is never welcomed by any guest in a hotel having global presence.

reviews.name: S3
reviews.review_head: Good Location,Good Service and Value for Money.
reviews.review_liked: Location of the hotel is excellent, the entire team at the hotel are a good set of people providing excellent service.

reviews.name: Jerome
reviews.review_liked: The hotel is conveniently located - bus stops and the Rocher MRT Station are nearby. It is also within walking distance to Little India and Bugis Junction.
reviews.review_disliked: The size of the room is quite compact (still comfortable who travel light).

reviews.name: Claire
reviews.review_liked: clean, great location, great pool
reviews.review_disliked: nothing

reviews.review_head: Small room good for a short stay

reviews.review_disliked: Very small room, though this seems typical for Singapore at this price pointShower flooded the bathroom easily

reviews.name: Richard
reviews.review_liked: noise

reviews.name: Cheryl
reviews.review_liked:
Comfortable bed.
Fittings appeared new.
reviews.review_disliked:
Room was small and cramped for 2 people.
Foldable luggage stand was pointless. If used it would have seriously restricted access around the bed or to the toilet/shower room which was also very tiny. The window was directly overlooked by the flats behind.
Overall I think there was more space at the Ibis Bencoolen which might be better value.
The only reason we booked was for the swimming pool but did not use as it was raining for most of the day and was overlooked by a new hotel under construction opposite.

reviews.review_liked: By price this hotel is excellent. It's not huge, staff very helpful.

reviews.review_liked: We loved the location - really close to the MRT. The staff were so friendly and accommodating.

reviews.review_liked: Nice place. Value for money. Location very good.

reviews.name: Helen
reviews.review_head: Loved the hotel and would stay there again.
reviews.review_liked: The size of the room. The style of the building.  Staff were very helpful and always solved any problems or queries we may have had.
reviews.review_disliked: The breakfast.  This is the only thing I didn’t like.  Poor choice of food and should have catered more for a more international clientele which is what the hotel has.

Room was a little small but was fine for our one night. Close to Little India and many shops.
reviews.review_disliked: Could use a little updating especially in the bathroom.

reviews.review_liked:
Proximity to MRT and busses
Breakfast was good

reviews.review_liked: Great location.

reviews.review_disliked: Only problem is it's too noisy at night and soundproof is too poor. The carpet outside smells musty. The construction around failed the view of this hotel. However, I did have a nice trip. Tks

reviews.review_liked: Cleanness

・Breakfast included a booking was very taisty.
especially the curry, egg omlets

reviews.review_liked: Location near everywhere

reviews.review_liked: excellent staff, location and facilities

reviews.name: Xiaofan
reviews.review_liked: Location is great and staff was helpful.
reviews.review_disliked: Facilities are a bit dated though still functioning well. Sound proofing isn’t good as we could hear the room above us partying all night dragging chairs for hours.

reviews.name: Bipradas
reviews.review_liked: Superb location, specially for Indians. 1 minute walking from Little India, plenty of Indian restaurants, money exchange, shopping area, Mustafa Centre, Bugis Street, MRT (metro rail), Temple all are located within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Most of the attractions, places are within 5 KM radius (by MRT) Great option…
reviews.review_disliked: nothing does special as such

reviews.name: Go
reviews.review_liked: The location... near to bugis, little india
reviews.review_disliked: The facility is limited and one of the escalators is faulty for 3 days (during my stay). The aircon in the lobby and second level is not cool.

reviews.review_liked: Great hotel, our room was upgraded for free. Staff were lovely and very efficient.
reviews.review_disliked: Breakfast is pricey

reviews.name: Lee
reviews.review_liked: Desk staff were excellent
reviews.review_disliked: The comforter on the bed was a little too much. Could not use my AMEX card in the restaurant.

reviews.name: Kimberly
reviews.review_head: Great service and value for money
reviews.review_liked: Very close to the MRT and the room was very comfortable. The staff were also excellent.

reviews.review_head: Helpful staff and comfortable rooms with plenty of space for luggage
reviews.review_liked: Great location. Close to the MRT

reviews.name: Mariana
reviews.review_liked: Location
reviews.review_disliked: Very Poor Breakfast

reviews.name: Pratikrshah
reviews.review_liked: Everything is very good it's specifically good for Indian because little india is very close walking 5 min and also walking distance from metro

reviews.name: Sree
reviews.review_liked: Location is great, close to Bugis station.
reviews.review_disliked: There's barely any WiFi in the room, horrible. I had to go close to the front desk in order to have functioning WiFi.

reviews.name: Meredith
reviews.review_head: Charming hotel in quiet, historic street
reviews.review_liked: Lovely location in a quiet street, near historic buildings and Little India. Short walk to metro station. Excellent, welcoming staff who let us check in very early after a long flight and upgraded our room.

reviews.name: Julia-claire
reviews.review_liked:
Very central and nice hotel. It is a little older but everything was tidy and clean. our room was quite small but we saw other more spacious rooms. For one night the size was absolutely fine and the bathroom was indeed a good size. 
The staff was very helpful and we were able to shower after check-out as our flight was in the evening.

reviews.name: Chez
reviews.review_liked: Great Location, clean rooms
reviews.review_disliked: Need to have a pool.

reviews.name: Kimberly
reviews.review_liked: Friendly staff and sound proof hotel. Covenient and accessible with malls, food stalls and public transport.
reviews.review_disliked: Not good food options for breakfast.

reviews.name: Suhas
reviews.review_liked: Front desk staff were very good.
reviews.review_disliked: Breakfast

reviews.name: Tony
reviews.review_head: Inexpensive option for short Singapore stop-over.
reviews.review_liked: Inexpensive by Singapore standards, quiet, comfy firm bed and pillows. Very close to train station and a 5-10 minute ride into the heart of the city. Cheap and tasty food centre nearby (although may not suit everyone’s taste). Friendly staff. Ideal for our two night stop-over in Singapore.
reviews.review_disliked: A slight musty smell which they attempted to address with a humidifier and some wear and tear but for the price paid as to be expected.

reviews.name: Kristine
reviews.review_liked: near to metrostation, near to reatuarants and convienience store
reviews.review_disliked: poor wifi connections in our room.

reviews.name: Yi
reviews.review_liked: Staff are friendy,provide their help with passion. Hotel location,5m to the MRT. Dinner street just located behide the Station.
reviews.review_disliked: The room is poorly soundproofed,but quiet when neighbors are good. Room is clean. But window outside is dirty.Good

reviews.name: Maria
reviews.review_head: Excellent location for a weekend trip
reviews.review_liked: Our room was comfortable and clean. We loved the bed and for the first time in weeks we slept like logs. The bathroom was a little dated, but that didn't matter, as it had everything needed. We also really appreciated the location, you could go anywhere and Little India was a gem for excellent food.

reviews.name: Palma
reviews.review_liked: the location
reviews.review_disliked: the Windows were dirty

reviews.review_liked: Heritage site

reviews.review_liked: Internet access was rubbish during our whole stay and not all sockets worked in our room.

reviews.name: Sung
reviews.review_liked: Locations are great. Close to Rochor station, walking distance to Bugis, Little India etc
reviews.review_disliked: Small and outdated room I guess thats what you get in an expensive place like Singapore.

reviews.name: Laura
reviews.review_liked: Not knowing the area, it was good and close to a few things
reviews.review_disliked: The bed was uncomfortable

reviews.name: Anantham
reviews.review_head: Comfortable and reasonable for the price we paid
reviews.review_liked: Staff were courteous and friendly. Room was comfortable
reviews.review_disliked: The internet was very unstable and slow throughout our stay at the hotel.

reviews.name: Bruce
reviews.review_liked:
A little dated in places tho enjoyed old world charm.
More lights for room to read and pack would be good plus a USB  charge point or plug.
reviews.review_disliked: Sinking plug broken room 1507

reviews.name: Kishor
reviews.review_liked: The space, clean rooms and staff.
reviews.review_disliked:
No drinking water available. Atleast a common water purifier should be there for guests to get drinking water instead of asking to get the bathroom tap water.
No restaurant in the hotel  available so every time we had  to get the food delivery from other hotels or go out for eating.
AC wasn't working properly.

reviews.name: Sandra
reviews.room_type: Discovery Package - Complimentary Upgrade to Deluxe Room & Other benefits
reviews.review_liked: Location was quite central and nestled between 2 MRT stations: Rochor and Little India  We were able to walk to most places with ease. Found food nearby easily. For those who are adventurous, it took us about 40-45 mins to walk from Lau Pa Sat to the Merlion to the hotel. We had many stops to take in the sights and area of interest.
reviews.review_disliked: There were no pool and their jacuzzi tub was closed when we were there.

reviews.name: Hardeep
reviews.review_liked: Great location, close to many MRT stations. Staff we friendly and helpful

reviews.name: Grachelle
reviews.review_head: practical choice with everything you need
reviews.review_liked: 1. staff- after more 12 hours continuous journey, children were so exhausted. there was a gentleman looking after luggage's (sadly didn't get his name) who was so accommodating. as it is early (8Am) and far from check in time, he offered washroom to freshen up and lobby to rest a bit. he was very kind and considerate. As children ended up dozing off on the couch, before 10AM Syed Aleedroos from the reception/check in, approached us to say, they managed to get us a room earlier and got my kids to properly rest. That gesture meant a lot for travelling families. Syed has been very kind and considerate too, same as housekeeping staff. kind and attentive but not intrusive.2. facilities - its basic but everything you need for a short stay. we stayed for 4 days and never lack anything. just perfect3. location - its near groceries, not too far from airport and few steps out are restaurants and shops. its pretty center4. bonus is: theres a Pubs with  outdoor sitting just  as you walk out of the hotel entrance. we even thought its part of the hotel as it is on the hotel strip.we love the place and will stay again if we return to SG.
reviews.review_disliked: 1. internet is not the best but doable2. could do more with breakfast

reviews.review_liked: great location and nice rooms

reviews.review_liked: Good accessibility to the city, convenience stores very nearby

reviews.review_head: Mostly clean and comfortable. Convinient location.

reviews.review_disliked: Saw a few cockroaches during my stay. No water bottles provided. A little dated.

reviews.review_head: chose hotel for its location and room size

reviews.review_disliked: wifi was giving us a hard time. we got a room with view of the hotel corridor and it wasn’t very nice - nothing to look at so we kept the curtains close most of the time. despite knowing we were 2 adults and 1 child in the room they kept only 2 towels every time they serviced the room. had to ask for an extra towel every evening and then wait for it for about 30 minutes to arrive. when you see 3 towels in use in the room kindly replace with 3 and not 2…

reviews.review_head: Pleasant and comfortable stay with whole family
reviews.review_liked: The hotel is really wonderful and located near to 2 MRT and Bus stations. In case you are looking for Indian food, you will have ample options very nearby. reviews.review_disliked: The non attentiveness of the reception staff. When I checked in I stood for 5 minutes in front the front desk as they were too busy doing their own business before paying attention to me. Furthermore the lack of eye contact is really disappointing. It makes one feel insignificant and not valued. I was messed around when went for dinner after being told by reception that I can charge the dinner to my room. After agreeing with the front desk and the management of the restaurant to pay the bill when I check out I was woken up from my room to go to the restaurant and pay the bill. I asked before I checked in about a late checkout and was told flat out that the policy was 12:00pm and that if I wanted to check out later I would be charged per hour and yet when I checked out and was waiting in reception the Sunday, I witnessed a European man asking for late checkout and he was granted that with no issues and no charges. what made me even more disappointed was the way in which his request was handled and responded to versus the way my request was responded to. Clear prejudice. I am really disappointed with the hotel as I was made to believe by the reviews that this hotel was professional and welcoming. I really did not see nor feel that.

reviews.name: Adnan
reviews.review_liked: 4 nights in Singapore with 2 kids. Booked family room and asked for an extra bed and Mr Syed went one step better and upgraded us to a quad room for free! Very clean, good amenities, more spacious a than expected and very comfortable. Bathroom was very clean and big too! Plenty of towels, pillows, etc. Location was a few minutes walk from plenty of local and Little India MRT which went direct to Harbourfront. Grab was easy to get too. Halal Breakfast was very good with egg station, cakes, toast, cereals, juices, fruits, Sausages, and every day changes between pancakes, French toast, hash browns, and some Indian items. It does get busy after 9.30am though so! The staff were very pleasant and friendly, especially the lady at the front desk and Mr Syed. We had some issues on the first night (electricity stopped working) which took some time to fix in the dark but it got resolved within 10 minutes. Mr Syed became more like a friend after some lovely chats and he hugged me goodbye! If we came to Singapore again, I'd definitely stay here again. Overall, very happy, 10/10!
reviews.review_disliked: To be critical with some suggestions. 1) bathroom needs a bidet spray, we really felt this loss. 2) outdoor windows need to be cleaned. They're filthy green with mould. Though we kept curtains closed! 3) fix the escalator going down (though there are lifts). 4) the big one, WiFi was awful. Couldn't stay connected for more than a few minutes, which is crucial these days for tourists.

reviews.review_head: I guess S$220 a night is a ‘cheap hotel’ in Singapore. I’m not sure how they were awarded 4 stars has this is clearly a
reviews.review_liked: Good location if you want to be close to Little India. Front desk is very friendly.
reviews.review_disliked:
Good location if you want to be close to Little India. Front desk is very friendly. But this hotel is best avoided.
I was given feather pillows, despite asking when making my online reservation 2 months prior to my stay, and after reminding them again upon check-in, that mr family can use only cotton/synthetic pillows. When I called at 10pm to replace my room’s 6 feather pillows with 6 non-feather pillows, a housekeeper showed up with one pillow. A feather pillow. 
So I made my another call to the front desk (with 2 tired and cranky toddlers) at 10:30pm, once again (this is the 4th time) for non-feather pillows I was told that the hotel only has feather pillows. I wish they had told me 2 months prior when I made the request. 
To make matters worse the bathtub was grimy and in disrepair, and couldn’t be filled (the drain was broken). I specifically chose this hotel because it has a bathtub, as I have 2 toddlers who like to bathe. 
When showering (our only option), the water pressure was very low. 
The wifi is objectively terrible. If and when it connects, it is extremely slow. I could barely load email!
There is no complementary water (unusual for a 4-star hotel, especially at this price point) and the tap water has a bad smell. 
The sound carries very easily and we could hear a crying child down the hall who sounded like he was in the room with us.

reviews.name: Lucia
reviews.review_liked: The description and the photographs on the website of the hotel and on Booking.com do not reflect the true tired and run-down state of the hotel.  The property needs a complete refurbishment.

reviews.name: Hassan

address: 2 Perumal Road, Unit 01-01, Lavender, 218773 Singapore, Singapore

reviews.name: Alan
reviews.review_liked:
The ease of the stay, from check in to check out.
Really useful to have the laundry facility.
The pizza options were excellent, even with so much choice of food just minutes away. Having the MRT just a few steps away was great.
The Great Lyf team made the stay perfect. Thank you
reviews.review_disliked: Having to leave 😭

reviews.name: Javier
reviews.review_liked: Great location, supermarket in front and a lot of restaurants around
reviews.review_disliked: The neighbors were to noisy at midnight, screaming and laughing in front of my door

reviews.name: Adam
reviews.review_liked: Location and gym.
reviews.review_disliked: Noisy at night. Some students stayed over, but we missed our sleep at nights and management didn't do anything after complaining.  Should have separated students from families.

reviews.name: Yue
reviews.review_liked: Room is big, great view.
reviews.review_disliked: The bathroom layout gives no privacy at all. No place to hang clothes when showering. Not a good room if you are sharing with another but I am staying alone not a problem.

reviews.name: Ankit
reviews.review_liked: Location is excellent. Well withing the reach of MRT stations and malls. Overall atmosphere is very welcoming and rooms are comfortable. We booked a two room set for our family of four and stayed for a week. Had a great time. Also the cafe downstairs has terrific food. Do check on the timings though.
reviews.review_disliked: I think the frequency and quality of cleaning could be better.

reviews.name: Aerm26
reviews.review_liked: Bed is the coziest ever! Second time staying with Lyf Farrer Park because of how accessible it is to the MRT and bus stop. There's a mall right across too in case you need food or other essentials.
reviews.review_disliked: None!

reviews.name: Didar
reviews.review_liked: Location was perfect near to farrer park statition and the room was clean
reviews.review_disliked: Bathroom and wc was inside the room there was just a glass between

reviews.name: Jiske
reviews.review_liked: Very friendly staff and also good location! Also the price, for Singapore standards, is fair, good value for money! It has everything that you need.
reviews.review_disliked: The room is one of the smallest hotel rooms we ever stayed, so it's good for a couple days of exploring the city but wouldn't recommend staying longer.

reviews.name: Karthick
reviews.review_liked: Everything - location, cleanliness, and most importantly staffs
reviews.review_disliked: I have been a regular customer and i have also invited my friends to stay in Lyf and eventually they did as well book. However, there is no recognition of the same.

reviews.review_liked: It’s hip!

reviews.review_liked: Great location! Mall with lots of food options and subway across the street.

reviews.review_head: very comfortable stay with everything ability around in few mins walk dist. really liked the 4th floor common cooking ar

reviews.review_liked: First one is the location of the property. Secondly, no frills and very clean rooms. Since we took this family rooms, it was very comfortable for a family of 4. Very efficient staff.

reviews.review_liked: Kitchen
reviews.review_disliked: Very small room. No refrigerator in the room and the one in the floor barely was working.

reviews.review_liked:
smart space-wise
good facility

reviews.review_liked: Great location in the heart of Little India, many restaurants nearby, very close to MRT station Farrer Park (you do not get wet when it's raining). Staff was very friendly and helpful.Bed was comfy and with a nice view.
reviews.review_disliked: nothing to complain about

reviews.name: Marc
reviews.review_liked: Location is goodStaff were friendlyPlace is clean

reviews.review_head: Good location and facilities. Best for solo or couple travelers.
reviews.review_liked: Really good location and the facilities are good.
reviews.review_disliked: The bathrooms are ridiculously small, you would have to be comfortable around whoever you were staying with because there’s no place/hangers to change clothes in the toilet or shower. People kept getting confused at the elvator because we could not tell when the card scanner read the hotel key.

reviews.name: Chatichai
reviews.review_liked: good location

reviews.review_liked: i like everything about this apartment.
reviews.review_disliked: 1 room was smell so badly,I don’t know why , they should clean it .

reviews.name: Tjhin
reviews.review_liked:
Awesome location, 30 seconds walk to entrance of MRT. 90 seconds walk to city square mall.
Private pantry, fridge, microwave practically a well equipped small apartment. 
Will be back for next visit to Singapore if 1 need 2 bedroom..
reviews.review_disliked: The staff clean the room weekly only.

reviews.name: Tsung
reviews.review_liked: Loved the two of a kind room; perfect for a three-people trip, as it includes two separate rooms and a shared kitchen with sink, plates, cups, etc.
reviews.review_disliked: The elevator is slow and sometimes with issues recognizing your card, but not an big deal, just longer wait.

reviews.review_liked: Great room and facilities. Quite central and the mall and MRT is close by.
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing

reviews.review_head: Perfect location, friendly staff, clean toilet, exactly like in the photos
reviews.review_liked: The location was perfect, very close to Mustafa in a walking distance. The MRT and Bus stop are just right next to the place. The staff was friendly and the laundry room was definitely how we expected.
reviews.review_disliked: The floor in our room was a bit sticky which is understandable, still could be improved.

reviews.name: Agnieszka
reviews.review_head: it was a nice room in a good price, good stay
reviews.review_liked: Our hotel was very nice, with a nice view. Good localisation, close to the centre and MRT station.
reviews.review_disliked: I don’t know if they clean every single day in rooms

reviews.name: Valentina
reviews.review_liked: Super nice staff, were very helpful and competent. Would definitely suggest staying there since its location is easy to reach.

reviews.name: Rafał
reviews.review_head: Highly recommended for private as well as for business purposes!
reviews.review_liked: Excellent price - quality ratio. Fantastic location and comfort of staying!

reviews.review_liked: Location was great via MRT
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing

reviews.name: Bram
reviews.review_liked:
Really enjoyed the different approach compared to a regular hotel. The rooms maybe small, but the common areas are spacious. MRT is nearby as well as a Mall for (amongst others) breakfast, coffee.
Staff was very friendly so you felt welcome.
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing really.

reviews.name: Chou
reviews.review_liked: No breakfast provided, can't rate. Location is perfect
reviews.review_disliked: No coffee complement.

reviews.name: Paula
reviews.review_liked: Co-living concept. Clean. Modern. Everything you need.
reviews.review_disliked: One receptionist unfriendly. Others nice. Too much noise from neighbours and cleaning crew.

reviews.name: Emmy
reviews.review_liked: The hotel was perfect! Great location and great facilities. Our room was very nice and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay there very much.

reviews.name: Bakhram
reviews.review_liked:
Comfortable modern style room. All on its place - no more no less.
Cozy area on 5-th flow with well equipped kitchen facility. Green area - like park with tables and chairs to seat, eat and take rest. Very smart and nice solution.

reviews.name: Rohan
reviews.review_head: Great place with infrequent room service
reviews.review_liked: Great facilities and value
reviews.review_disliked: Not much room service

reviews.name: Lana
reviews.review_liked: Great spot, close to attractions via MRT, lots of fun on Level 1, look out for the gatherings and book early! Perfect for anyone who wants to tourist😍👍
reviews.review_disliked: I wish people would have told me about tourist cards for 3 day travel on the MRT and deposit refunds, and the fact if you buy big you can claim back your GST at the airport as long as you show peeps. So put your purchases in the same bag when you head tot the airport 👍

reviews.name: Malik
reviews.review_head: good location and ideal for families
reviews.review_liked: location, apartment style

reviews.name: Jb
reviews.review_liked: We had a great stay at Lyf Singapore! The room was new and clean (and surprisingly spacious). There was a bunch of space for hanging out downstairs, and also a large kitchen (which we did not end up using). The gym was small, but had everything needed for a brief workout.I wouldn't hesitate to stay again the next time I'm in Singapore!
reviews.review_disliked: Some of the neighbors can be a bit loud (especially the families and kids), but there's not something the hotel can really do so I don't fault them for it.

reviews.name: Andrea
reviews.review_liked: location
reviews.review_disliked: noisy

reviews.name: Iz_zy
reviews.review_liked:
Super close to train station - bonus with suitcases! 
The staff were super friendly and helped get us checked in little earlier as we had 3 rooms booked. 
Shopping Centre located across the road is a bonus too. Great for a 3night stay before moving on.
reviews.review_disliked: No fridge in the rooms. We were able to use the community fridge on the floor which was better than nothing just not convenient when it's soo hot in Singapore. It wasn't a deal breaker the rooms were comfortable - I would've opted for the connecting room if it was available too with a family of 4.

reviews.name: Tricia
reviews.review_liked: Location is very near at a train station and bus stop 1-2mins away, a mall across the street, supermarkets, restaurants. Room is small but very functional. Hotel has gym, common kitchen (looks like your in master chef), laundry, pizza shop, very cozy lounges. Very friendly staffs!
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing. Everything is good!

reviews.name: Blessica
reviews.review_liked: Amazing place!!!

reviews.name: Antoni
reviews.review_liked: The location is spot on, Little India nearby has a little cheaper hawker centers but if you want something more fancy it's still nearby. MRT station right next to the hotel. The lobby is always lively, there is a bar and a restaurant. Exceptionally helpful staff. Rooms are super clean and comfortable. It's a wonderful place to stay in Singapore.

reviews.name: Phatnichanont
reviews.review_liked: The room is quite smalll for 2 persons.

reviews.name: Manop
reviews.review_liked: Location is excellent, there is a big mall opposite the property. The MRT station is just 3-minute walk.

reviews.name: Nofar1
reviews.review_liked: The place looks nice, the bed was comfortable, feels more like a hostel than a hotel
reviews.review_disliked: there was no hot water in the shower for some parts of the day. I think there are better places for the amount of money they charge. there is no pool or fridge in the room, not even instant coffee or tea.

reviews.name: Kothari
reviews.review_liked: we did not took break fast and location was very nice near mrt and little india perfect

reviews.name: Choon
reviews.review_liked: It was clean! :)
reviews.review_disliked: Soundproofing wasn’t very good. Pantry was right outside our door and it gets noisy whenever someone is there.

reviews.review_liked: Very clean, helpful staff and close to MRT

reviews.name: Lee
reviews.review_liked: Nice environment, clean room, friendly staff
reviews.review_disliked: For Laundry, would be good to put the price for washing and drying

reviews.name: Sarita
reviews.review_liked: Great location, easy access to MRT and eateries. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.review_disliked: Maybe a bar fridge in rooms. We love our teas and coffee, had to get the milk from the fridge in the hallway. Everything else was great.

reviews.review_liked: very convenient and near to MRT. Our reception is kind and welcoming.

reviews.review_disliked: didn’t have anything to dislike because everything was provided and they had all the facilities and necessities.

reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.name: Huy
reviews.review_head: Quite okay, but not a fan of the area.
reviews.review_liked: It's very clean, big rooms, with very good appliances. Friendly staff. Many additional benefits such as gyms and self laundry. Close to a subway station.
reviews.review_disliked: Self laundry cost coins. No in house restaurants. A little bit far from city centre, if one doesn't like Indian food.

reviews.review_head: gud property but it should have cleaning on daily baisis
reviews.review_liked: location
reviews.review_disliked: No cleaning on daily basis

reviews.name: Wei
reviews.review_liked: Amazing hospitality! Staff were friendly and the room space were amazing! Great facilities and the stay throughout was very comfortable.
reviews.review_disliked: Neighbour room was having gathering across a few rooms and was loud everytime they were leaving the rooms in the morning and evening. They even had a gathering meal in one of the room (beside our room), leaving the door open n making noise as if the whole floor was theirs.

reviews.name: Cristy
reviews.review_liked: New, clean property just across the street from the nearest subway. In Little India, near tons of shops and restaurants. Friendly staff. Nice spaces for working and socializing. Good value for Singapore.
reviews.review_disliked: Rooms are small.

reviews.name: Prasath
reviews.review_head: Cozy, Comfortable and a great value while in Singapore.
reviews.review_liked: Centrally located (great mall across the street with access to lots of retail and food options including early am coffee for those who are jet lagged). rooms were clean and comfortable.  I was skeptical about how to a co-living property would workout for our stay but this exceeded my expectations! the staff also went out of their way to leave a handwritten card and snack for my spouse’s birthday with no request from our part at all. Very thoughtful!
reviews.review_disliked: None. I thought I would find the housekeeping policy of once every week an issue but not at all. the light housekeeping after 2 nights worked out real well with fresh towels.

reviews.name: Marcela
reviews.review_liked: The property is across the street from the MRT and very conveniently located, with a shopping centre with coffee and supermarket across the street too. There’s self service laundry, kitchen and work spaces, so seems good for long stays. It’s a nice bright space. The bed was comfortable and they give you a water jug to refill in the hallway which is a nice little touch. Also lots of hangers in the room for clothes and the aircon works well (a must in Singapore!)
reviews.review_disliked:
Whilst it looked generally clean, I found fake eye lashes (presumably from the cleaner?) in my bedsheets and little dirty corners around the room. 
The shower was only warm on the first day, on the second night and last morning the water was cold. To be fair, I didn’t raise these with reception because the elevators are so slow it takes at least 5 minutes waiting to go down to speak to staff as there’s no phone in the room. If I had told them, maybe they would have addressed it. 
I also didn’t notice upon booking that there’s no minibar in the room. This was challenging in the heat of Singapore as tap/filter water is lukewarm and we couldn’t buy anything to keep in the room, so just beware. There was a tiny shared fridge in the hallway but it was full and very very smelly, so we didn’t use it.

reviews.review_head: Homely with lots of fun things to explore!
reviews.review_liked: Had to stay here for just over a week — made the booking just the night before due to sudden changes to my schedule, but was thankful for the helpful staff at the counter who helped to ensure a smooth check-in process.Really appreciated the lovely communal areas like the garden on Level 4, the giant chessboard near the entrance, and features like the little blackboard outside our room! My partner and I felt quite at home and even had dinner in the garden a few times. Location is convenient — it was easy to get to the city and we could top up on daily essentials at the mall just across the road (City Square Mall). Rooms were also clean and easy to maintain.
reviews.review_disliked: A little pricey considering the size of the room, but the layout was well-designed such that there was ample space for us to store our things. Laundry was also a tad expensive ($6 each for washing and drying) but detergent was provided, and my clothes came out smelling and feeling really nice so that was a huge plus! There also isn't a pool if that is something you look for in an accommodation, but honestly there were so many other things to do that we really weren't bothered.Toiletries provided were quite fancy as well and used natural ingredients with a pleasant fragrance, but you might want to be careful if you have sensitive skin as some ingredients might be drying (my partner and I both have dry skin and experienced some irritation by the end of our stay).

Very comfortable stay, felt right at home. lyf guard Edward was super friendly and helpful. The two of a kind had everything we need for our stay. There’s a water dispenser on every floor. Getting Grab ride, grab food delivery and going around on MRT is very easy during our stay. It was never noisy, granted we were on the 14th floor. The TV connected seamlessly to my phone so I could stream any movies I like. Never had a problem with the fast wifi.
reviews.review_disliked: some black stains on corners of bathroom floor. one of the toilet cubicles had a jet spray on the left side so that was pretty awkward to use.

reviews.review_liked: Location is convenient with metro station right next to the hotel.  Staff are very friendly and helpful. The large kitchen on the 4th floor is great for those travelers who prefer cooking their own meals. Water dispenser on each floor is convenient to refill water. There is also a small shared fridge on each floor which can be filled up quickly.
reviews.review_disliked: Room cleaning is only available every 7 night stay which is a bit long,  given Singapore is very hot and humid. Garbage is only collected twice for the 9 nights that we stayed.  The hallway is not cleaned regularly.  I can see hair in the corridor and dirty stain on the floor.

reviews.review_disliked: N/A

reviews.name: Bristol
reviews.review_liked: Location was perfect being so close to the underground meant we could litreally go anywhere within minutes, hotel staff extremely polite and helpful.  The rooftop garden was gorgeous.  Great facilities throughout the hotel so could do all our washing and drying with ease. The style and functionality of the hotel added to the whole experience and it seemed really good value for money compared to other hotels.  Room was always cool with the AC running when we were out so made coming back to cool off a relief.  The rain shower was perfect for a quick freshen up in the middle of the day after getting hot being out and about.
reviews.review_disliked: The hotel was lovely, fresh and clean.  First appearance of the room was absolutely fine but on further inspection it did feel like the room was dirty.  Floor didn't seem like it was cleaned (hoovered and mopped) as walking around bare feet felt uncomfortable.  Dusty sides and cupboards throughout the room.  Small amount of mould on one of the walls by the AC unit which looked like it had been cleaned in the past but was reoccurring.  Likely due to the climate making this an impossible task to completely remove.  Myself and partner did give it a wet wipe clean before feeling absolutely comfortable.  After our improvised clean we did give it a 4 in a bed style check over but didn't find any horrors and the bed was lovely and clean and it really wouldn't have took much to bring it to the top standard the rest of the hotel had.  They did allow us to check in early so we do think this may have been an isolated incident to get us in as quickly as possible which we were really greatful of as we just had a 20 hour commute to get there.  I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other people so I hope my honest reviews don't put anyone off as we feel that this hotel really does a good job at catering for it's guest and the demographic of travellers it appeals to.

The shared kitchen and garden areas were a really nice space.

reviews.name: Alyza
reviews.review_head: Lyf Farrer Park will always have a special place in our heart.
reviews.review_liked: Location: The hotel location is very near to train (Farrer Park Stn.)- which are a few stops away from Chinatown, doby Ghaut and even Harbourfront for anyone who plans to visit Sentosa Island or Batam; and bus station (bus no 131 from city central). Facilities: the facilities is beyond my expectation. We really did not expect that there are full facility laundry room including iron and steamer. We are staying in a 2 bedroom apartment with pantry and full kitchen facilities. But the hotel also provides an outdoor common area for us to have a small gathering, bbq and normal cooking, which rarely found in any hotels in Singapore. The indoor common area at the lobby is huge and facilitated with cafe and vending machines. The property even provide 24 hour gym for indoor and outdoor. Staff: Staff is very polite, helpful, friendly and thoughtful. They pay attention to special requests. They even gave an early birthday gift such as greeting card and cookies for my friend, even though he’s not the one who made the booking to this property. In my previous experience, hotels only pay attention to guest who made the reservation. Neighbourhood: The neighborhood is very safe and quiet at night and day. Very peaceful for night owl to hang out at night and sleep in till the afternoon. Very near to city square mall too.  Indian food lovers will be thrilled to stay here as it is surrounded by numerous Indian restaurant (vegetarian or not).
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing! Will definitely come back and recommend the hotel to everyone.

nice and the pillows and towels were clean and fluffy. 
I love the room design too and the view from the room. 
The lounge at the lobby and the garden at level 4 were also cozy and
nice. Make sure you don’t miss to spend some times
in the garden. I also love the water refill so we can reduce 
the use of the plastic bottle. The guard when I checked out , 
Asraf, was also nice and helpful.
Overall, I had a good experience at Lyf Farrer Park.
Oh the location was nice too, near to Little India and a
lot of nice Indian Restos, and it was pretty quiet and peaceful at night.

the price is a bit high for the cleaning and facilities I would expect the room to be a bit cleaned as our pillow case had flood and the bathroom was quite dirty, not sure if we were unlucky.
reviews.review_disliked: pleasant stay just needs to improve on clean.

reviews.name: Caspar
reviews.review_liked:
very welcoming and helpful staff!
great location and facilities.
coffee place downstairs is great!

reviews.name: Jimmy
reviews.review_head: Great value for money to discover the city!
reviews.review_liked: Great value for money, the metro is just around the corner in a nice area of Singapore. The rooms are small, but you have everything you need. The shower is good and you have a separate toilet. The bed is also very nice.

reviews.name: Johan
reviews.review_liked: Nice design, internal garden, facilities

reviews.review_head: will be happy to come again for sure

- two of a kind just nice for my family of 5 with our kids aged 14, 12 and 9
- great location near farrer park station and indian restaurants
- always approachable and super informative Ms Jana at reception
reviews.review_disliked: nothing worthwhile to complaint

reviews.name: Caroline
reviews.review_liked: Excellent location, close to the tube and shopping centre. Very  good staff, easy check in. Lovely comfortable bed.

reviews.name: James
reviews.review_head: Value for money but strictly for a community living fan
reviews.review_liked: Overall value for money. Like the location and the concept. Right next to the MRT station. Food are also easily available around the location. Not to mention, there is a cozy common area to dine plus a shared kitchen to DIY your own meal. Very helpful and friendly staffs too. In a community living concept, simple cleaning and thorough cleaning once a week is fair. Like the toiletries provided too. Gym are also available on the ground floor.
reviews.review_disliked: If it's not for the ventilation in the room and the drainage in the toilet/bathroom it would have been an easy 10. Due to the humidity and the AC (for obvious tropical heat reason), the smell from the drainage is slightly unbearable for me. But for my partner who has a sensitive sense of smell, needless to say we didn't get a good night sleep. We specially requested the window to be unlocked so we can air the room plus the helpful maintenance guy who came to clean/unclog the drainage. The smell was gone for few hours and then the nightmare came back. So we just keep the window open as and when we can't bear with it. Thanks to the raining season, it's pretty cooling at night without the AC.

reviews.name: Sittie
reviews.review_liked: Very near from the MRT wc is so convenient. the ambiance was so new and millenial as well.
reviews.review_disliked: maybe that there’s no ref inside rooms

reviews.name: Mason
reviews.review_liked: Loved the convenience and location. Lots of places to shop, eat, and just walk around.
reviews.review_disliked: Very minimalist room design with not much going on in it. Perfect for me, but probably not good or convenient for others.

reviews.name: Mohammad
reviews.review_liked: Bed, view and level 4 establishments
reviews.review_disliked: No almirah/closet. Small shower room, and no arrangement of cloth and towel hanging in the shower room.

reviews.name: Graham
reviews.review_liked:
A bit different to what we are used to,
but a really good experience. No one could of done more.

reviews.name: Molai
reviews.review_liked: Breakfast was not an option location is amazing, it's in the city centre and in little India near to Mall and Mustafa Centre simply amazing, gym was good
reviews.review_disliked: Just a bit expensive but worth it, over all I would recommend everyone safe, clean and centrally located, and staff was cooperative and friendly

reviews.name: Paula
reviews.review_head: Cosy place with everything that is needed.

reviews.name: Daniel
reviews.review_liked:
Really nice garden next to the kitchen on the 4th floor, a wonderful place to have breakfast with the sunrise.
Gym and laundry services were open 24h which was very useful.
Could adjust/turn off the air con from our room, and it was powerful when we did want it.
Nice view from the room over the city.
Pleasant common spaces particularly on the ground floor. We loved the giant chess!
Close to the Farrer Park MRT station, and you can also access a large shopping centre across the road using the MRT underpass.

reviews.name: Mary
reviews.review_liked: Hotel is in a prime location - MRT is just a stone's throw away. A mall is across it. You have laundry, restaurant and just about anything you need. A home away from home.

reviews.name: Shawn
reviews.review_head: Comfortable, convenient but lacking basic room amenities.
reviews.review_liked: Liked the location. It is super close to Farrer Park MRT station, City Square Mall and Mustafa Centre.This is a very hipster hotel, from the room decor to the open commune facilities. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.
reviews.review_disliked: Perhaps they took the hipster concept a bit too far, the room didn't come with any amenities like a toothbrush, a TV, a phone, a mini fridge or bottle waters (which are basic but important). There is a "common" bar fridge outside the room which can be used by all guests on that floor, but that's not really the same is it?

reviews.name: Salvador
reviews.review_liked: The location was perfect. It is very easy to access all of Singapore. The facility is nice, you've got all covered, no hassle and amenities are good for short business trips, leisure travel.
reviews.review_disliked: The vending machines dont accept cash

reviews.name: Cheng

reviews.review_head: Great Location and Very Clean. Terrible and Rude Front Desk.
reviews.review_liked: The location is great and the hotel was very clean. It was also very quiet so it helped me to get a good sleep at night. The layout of the room was also very convenient. Highly recommend! I enjoyed my stay here.
reviews.review_disliked: I stayed here for a week and the ONLY disappointing thing was my check-in process. There was this girl with glasses at the front desk who handled my check-in process. I think when I checked in, it was nearly end of her shift. She was constantly checking her Grab app every 5 seconds to see where her ride was and drinking bubble tea.  She just tossed my passport and key (with wifi password) back to me and that was it.  Not a single explanation about how to use gym, shared kitchen, water fountain, or anything. Absolutely NOTHING at all.    All she ever said to me was "Can I have your passport?" and "Here is the wifi password"

reviews.review_disliked: Considering that it's a 4 starts hotel it's a bit disappointing that the room was not made up any time during my stay. My room was just in front of a small kitchen corner in the corridor and next to the elevator. As following all the noises from the corridor were hearable. Moreover, I did not like that the hotel was sending me several messages before my stay to download an application, which in the end wasn't even used.

reviews.name: Felipe
reviews.review_liked: There were some sounds really early at morning, sounded like an animal in the building.

reviews.review_liked: Freshness and it was new
reviews.review_disliked: Was there for 10 days, only one deep clean and had to ask if the cleaner had mopped the floor, no just a quick sweep. She was in a rush, which is understandable when housekeeping is outsourced and KPI has to be met but to the detriment of the customer. This is supposed to be a 4-star hotel. Found toilet smelled also, and I don't think it was cleaned certainly not at the week point. As for a light clean that was changing bins and towels. It seems the model of outsourcing meets the managers bonus but does not meet the customers.  Have stayed in 4 stars in many Singapore hotels. This was the worst

reviews.name: Yang
reviews.review_liked: The size of the room was ok for a Singapore service apartment. The view was great. Room was very clean and the staff were very helpful. Pretty close to MRT. Remember to use exit G from the MRT station to the apartment.

reviews.name: Adrical
reviews.review_head: More a dorm, than a hotel
reviews.review_liked:
1. Two gyms (small outdoor one and bigger inside). They are open 24/7. But be aware of bringing your own mat. The floors are super dirty and they don't have mats or towels in the gym you could use.
2. The restaurant in the lobby is nice. 
3. We were able to check in early. 
4. Room equipment: kettle with mugs, safe, hair dryer and USB plugs in the room. No TV. The fridge is only on the hallway. 
5. The hotel is located in Little India (many small indian restaurants and small shops, but also very busy and loud). There is a mall across the street with many shops and food court. The metro station is also right at the corner.
6. Eco-friendly hygiene products
reviews.review_disliked: This is more a dorm than a hotel. They do not provide breakfast, but there is a kitchen where you can cook your own food. They don't clean every day, only once a week. Our room wasn't unfortunately super clean, especially the shower. The rooms are quite small and not very comfortable for two people.

reviews.name: Scorpius0411
reviews.review_liked: The Lobby and sitting area at level 4
reviews.review_disliked: The cleaning of the room only once a week and no tv in the room.

reviews.review_liked: Design, staff, close to MRT
reviews.review_disliked: No soundproofing towards hallway, impossible to properly ventilate room.

reviews.review_liked: Staffs are very helpful and friendly. Easy access to MRT and city square mall right across the street. Very nice room with big comfortable bed.Overall clean.
reviews.review_disliked: Ventilation could be better. The room felt damp for a long time after shower. Can hear music outside everyday from early in the morning and until around 22.30 at night.  The volume didn't bother us while we were awake, and didn't wake us up in the morning but it was hard to sleep early.

reviews.review_liked: Awesome reception service and great location, near to the MRT station.
reviews.review_disliked: Nothing.

reviews.name: Mary
reviews.review_liked: Helpful staff, convenient location, quiet rooms.

reviews.name: Ratan
reviews.review_liked:
Location of hotel was near to little India and mustafa centre. Lots of options here for food and shopping. Also lyf has well designed spacious reception, plus flat interiors are amazing with city view.
I recommend this hotel.

reviews.name: Synneg
reviews.review_liked: The location is great - right around the corner of MRT-station and across the street from a medium sized mall. If you want to explore on foot its possible from here, but you might want to take MRT. The hotel has everything you need for staying a while, maybe especially if having traveled in more remote areas beforehand: like a gym, a laundry-room, computers. I came very early for check-in and room wasn't ready, but the lady at reception fixed and got in contact with me for check-in hours before the normal check-in time. Note that shower/toiletroom is accessible straight from main room (check floorplan) just not to be surprised. For a solo short stay this was a nice affordable hotel with good views and a good nights sleep.
reviews.review_disliked: No coffee/tea available in room (very easy to buy in one of the shops down the street however). However was vending machines downstairs that might have had options.

reviews.name: Shu-huei
reviews.review_liked: Location. It's just next to Ferrer Park station.

reviews.name: Brook
reviews.review_head: Good overall: great location and comfortable.
reviews.review_liked:
it’s very close to the Farrer Park subway station and there’s a bus station right outside. 
The bed was quite comfortable and the room was decent size for Singapore. 
The laundry station was very convenient and easy to use- $6 for a wash and $6 for dry.
The hotel sent email updates about events happening in the area which was very courteous considering there was a major religious festival coming up at the temple nearby where up to 40,000 people might attend. 
The individual work stations in the lobby were comfortable and cozy.
reviews.review_disliked: The floor in my room was dirty and so were the glass cups. The hallways were not air conditioned. I don’t think it would have been comfortable to have two people stay in my room.

reviews.name: Harry
reviews.review_liked: Good location next to MRT, very clean and spacious, good facilities e,g gym and kitchen

reviews.name: Gc
reviews.review_liked: The whole place had such a fun cool vibe. We initially didnt want to book this hotel because there were no TVs in any of the rooms available, but it turned out to be a great thing because it forced us to get out of our rooms and explore singapore. We made use of the laundry room (quite expensive), the gym, kitchen.We thought not having housekeeping for a week was going to make our room messy and smelly, but it was fine. AC temperature was so perfect Super loved that yeast side cafe was right in the lobby, amazing pastries.For those planning to stay, you can request slippers and cotton buds at the counter upon check in!Mrt and bus station is just a few steps away and I think that's one of the major upsides of this place. It made our vacation efficient and convenient.

reviews.name: Aylisi
reviews.review_liked: The room was spacious and the bed was super comfortable. Charging points were near the bed and included USB ports so no need for an adapter. Shower and toilet were in separate rooms which was great and both super clean. The shower (and esp rainfall attachment) was superb - the water pressure was better than the showers at Changi Lounge.  Quality shampoo, conditioner and body wash are included though l did end up preferring my own.  You can't really hear the traffic below except for some hornw and barely the water running in other rooms - if you need complete silence this may bother you but as a super light sleeper l had amazing sleep in my room. The free toiletries and other gifts were really welcome - l got two sets since the room was for two which l thought was really thoughtful. Big room with a large window which gave great light during the day, and three sets of lights which were great during the night. Each room can control its own aircon temperature which was great as the room was so refreshing after being out all day. Each floor has a water station, sink and mini fridge and a kettle + cups is included in the room. There isn't really anywhere to get ice or cold water though but it shouldn't be a great bother.City Park Mall is just across the road, barely 2 minutes away which includes lots of food, Don Don Denki (a massive Japanese grocery store), Watsons (beauty/cosmetics), shopping and more.  The staff were really courteous and the lobby was a great place to hang out or relax before venturing out for the day. Wi-Fi was strong, didn't have any issues with it the entire stay. Outside area on level 4 was nice although too hot to stay around. Kitchen was nice although a strong grease smell.
reviews.review_disliked: I would recommend a place more central if you are going for the F1 weekend like l was. Several entrances for Farrer Park MRT are very close but to get to the platform it's still a walk and day after day it can be a bit much. Especially since you have to transfer at Dhoby Ghaut and possibly once more to get to the closest entrance to your gate. (Mine was Gate 1B). The nearest bus stop for me to get to the track was also almost two blocks away but keep in mind due to road closures during F1 there's more walking to be done. If you are planning on solely using public transport l would recommend somewhere closer in the city. As for Grab which l did use towards the end of my stay it was less than 10-15 minutes to just about anywhere which is fantastic if you are going to depend on driving instead. One of my Grab drivers did caution me about walking around in the neighbourhood at night but after several nights of returning around 11pm l didn't find it overly unnerving.   My room was not ready for me upon check-in which wasn't great considering the flight/missing out on F1 events but l understand it was a busy time (waited around half an hour). The room made up for it in spades. Water does leak out under the shower door but that's easily remedied by placing one of your many towels underneath the door to absorb it - l didn't find it a major nuisance. Washing and drying on the first floor was great however you have to pay for them each separately which can add up especially given Singapore's weather you do end up washing clothes after every wear. The key card especially for the elevator could also be a bit glitchy at times. If your trip does bring you around the area then l wouldn't discourage you from staying. If the rooms and service is the same across its other locations then l would definitely stay with this chain again.

reviews.review_disliked: The noise echo chamber from outside the room. I was woken up very early by inconsiderate guests who decided to carry on a conversation with their door open as they packed to leave… their talking echoed around the tiled floors and straight in under the door, like they were in the room. similar the next evening with a guy standing in the corridor having a conversation on the phone, as well as the loud beeps from the water dispenser or whatever it is (I didn’t use it) in the shared kitchenette - loud enough to wake you because the whole place is tiled and it echoes. The property tries to pretend it’s funky and “share house” theme, but really they’re just cutting corners on things like housekeeping (they say they only change towels on the third day, was actually the fourth day for me), no fridge in the rooms etc, yet still charge full hotel price. If you’re a super heavy sleeper, then you’ll enjoy the comfy bed.

reviews.name: Najma
reviews.review_liked: The room was spacious, clean, fresh and rejuvinating and comes with big bottles of complimentary shampoo, conditioner, hand wash and body wash. Also comes with hair dryer, glasses for water and tea etc. The air conditioner was never too cold or too warm, just right. Staff were welcoming and not rude.For a solo female traveller as myself, you will feel safe and secure. For like 2 people guests, the room may feel small if you have large luggage but the bed is quite large and comfortable. Light cleaning done in my room daily (had no idea as staff told me otherwise) but luckily nothing was taken from my room where i had my suitacases open and left unlocked - so very secure and trustable.No hassle of language barrier Located close to bus stops and MRT that take you into central singapore and other areas as it is quite a small cityi was only on the 8th floor but the view from the large windows was still very niceI would stay here again if i found a good deal on price!
reviews.review_disliked: -The breakfast provided was nothing excepational and quite expensive (tho this latter part is normal for singapore so come prepared! A banana and peanut butter on toast cost me £10!)-The hotel doesnt allow you to extend for one more day, you have to pay the equivlilant of two nights to stay an extra night, no matter the situation, which is just inconvenient and greedy from their side. -The room doesnt come with slippers for toilets and shower so you have to provide your own if you do plan on staying here to be most comfortable-The toilet and shower is not in their own section or room but like a one way street with your bedroom so the floor is bound to get wet from the shower-The door of your hotel room is so slow in closing and one time it didnt even, i had to get up and push it closed so you have to be extra careful and sure and not just leave it to itself to close (but it does lock automatically and really well once it closes and the latch sounds)-Water is self-service and have to go out of the room to collect but not too big a deal

lack of service despite it being a 4 star rated hotel
no shower cap, toothbrush, robe, slipper provided in the room
cleaning services unavailable for short stays, meaning towels will be wet and unchanged unless you go down to request - this all of course takes up time
the twin room was not cleaned or made up
photos of the bin unemptied, died flies  and beds left like that upon checkin - you can see short hair strands left on the bedding despite us being girls. we complained about the hygiene to the staff member requesting a clean who then shouted at us stating there was a lapse of time for the complaint- we dropped off our luggage at Checkin to go travel and only spoke to them after returning at night. they did not clean our room and gave us a new bedsheet for us to put on the bed ourselves.
at this price range, just avoid this place and opt for alternatives

I had to resort to using VPN to safeguard my information.I also would like to draw your attention to maybe your network because, soon after I made the payment for my stay, I was informed by my bank that there were some transactions on my credit card from suspicious parties trying to make withdrawals. I would advise future travelers to beware .

Sunday came and my room was not clean, trash full, and no toilet paper. they said they’ll do it Monday and asked what time is good for me, I said 1pm and they confirmed. Monday rolls around and it’s 3pm. room not clean, I went down to reception and they said they’ll get it done now. 5pm hits and still nothing done. I mean I just want my room clean. maybe next time I’ll just change the sheets and bedding myself if the staff is too lazy to do their job. I won’t ever stay at an ascot property again.

reviews.name: Lorenzomorganti
reviews.review_head: Infestation of flies, hundreds in 8 days. I will never go back!
reviews.review_liked: The location is spectcular near Farrer Park, the building is new and the staff are nice. Plus parking is easily found nearby and it is free overnight. The view from our room on 18th floor was quite amazing.
reviews.review_disliked: The fridge on our floor and the kitchen on the 4th floor were completely full and smelly, it was gross to use them. Our stay in the room was honestly a nightmare. We spent 8 nights at Lyf and only after 7 days (upon asking) someone came to clean the room which was in dire conditions after so many days. The room itself is small and cramped, not suitable for long stays. Additionally, our room was literally infested with little flies that kept coming up from the drains and were buzzing all over the room. We killed at least one hundred and still every time we came back we found many flying across the room. It made us vomit, utterly disgusting! I suggest the management to do something about the flies as it is unacceptable to sleep in a room full of flies. I am attaching pictures of a small number of the flies we had to kill to sleep in a quiet room without disturbance. Our stay was, in one word, UNPLEASANT! Avoid at all costs!

reviews.name: Rajagopalan
reviews.review_head: It was a clean and tidy place but basic amenities is a must.
reviews.review_liked:
- Clean & tidy
- Staff are helpful & smiling
- Location is good & convenient
reviews.review_disliked:
- There is no wardrobe in the room !
- Basic minimum cutlery like plates, spoons & forks required. (If you order take away and want to eat in your room)
- No TV and fridge in room
- Full cleaning only once a week is less
- Coffee and Tea disposables should be provided.

reviews.name: Zac
reviews.review_liked: Nil
reviews.review_disliked: Get ready to be awaken by the neighboring temple chimes every morning at 8am, including weekends. (I live on the 17th floor and I can hear it loud and clear) They only clean the room once every 3 days, service staff isn't 24/7, room doesn't come with toiletries like toothbrush/toothpaste, and doesn't have a TV even though there's a TV port. Oh and the craziest part is you'll have to share the fridge with other guests - no fridge in room, you'll have to label your own food.
